intro: Linaria macilenta, commonly known as the slender toadflax, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a low-growing annual or biennial plant that typically reaches a height of about 10–30 centimeters. The plant produces bright yellow, spurred flowers that bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs. Linaria macilenta is adapted to dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as fields and coastal areas.
